intro: Streptocalyx squamifer, commonly known as the scaly streptocalyx, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces distinctive, waxy, scale-like structures on its stems, which give it its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky substrates. The flowers are typically yellow or orange and attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
